<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">[Barkskin](/Spells.aspx?ID=20)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 320 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Gendowyn](/Deities.aspx?ID=152), [Gendowyn](/Deities.aspx?ID=152)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

The target's skin becomes covered in bark. The target gains resistance 2 to bludgeoning and piercing damage and weakness 3 to fire. After the target takes fire damage, it can Dismiss the spell as a free action triggered by taking the damage; doing so doesn't reduce the fire damage the target was dealt.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The resistances increase by 2, and the weakness increases by 3.
name: Barkskin
